title: Question 5
prompt:
Sentence 14: Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions about Amanda’s experience at our firm.

If you rewrote sentence 14 beginning with “If you have any questions…” the next words should be:
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
“If you have any questions about Amanda’s experience at our firm” is a subordinate clause in the sentence. The subordinate clause can come at the end of the sentence, as in the current sentence, or at the beginning of the sentence, as in the rewritten sentence. When you move a subordinate clause from the end of the sentence to the beginning of the sentence, the whole clause should stay together. The next words to follow “If you have any questions…” will still be “about Amanda’s.”


Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions about Amanda’s experience at our firm.
If you have any questions about Amanda’s experience at our firm, please feel free to contact me.
